p.span: middle class I'm like his middle classes

80,000 my parents make a t-1000 and I
felt the I didn't belong in this
high-class rich place and I got me
thinking about privilege and privilege
is a pretty nebulous turned so it's used
by politicians all the time either to
mean like mean like you have too much
money should be taxed more or some sort
of racial implication but there's also
much more insidious type of privilege
and privilege I've had like my parents
are able to take me to extracurricular
activities I was able to go to taekwondo
I was able to debate and I didn't have
to worry about the police and stuff like
that so it's not really the privilege a
very rich man or very powerful man and
there are many of those many many rich
and powerful men but the thing is is
that beyond these rich and powerful
madness in CID you aside for privilege
the type that I would bet that most of
us have experienced where we get to talk
ninety-four percent of the time that's
something that's also very worrying and
me and my comrades at him so over the
past two or three years develop various
solutions for this as part of a working
into student council and this was to
serve the anti Trump's in a way the
people who don't have that privilege the
people who are left behind by what the
establishment or whatever you want to
call it and the technique was called
listening and learning so ostensibly
it's a very simple technique go out and
talk to people but it's a very powerful
technique imagic you do one of those
like Vulcan mind melds or whatever I'm
not sci-fi fan with your user group for

what they wanted how they want it
delivered all of it that's what
listening and learning lets you do

from you and also understood what led
